page.title: 03Inversnaid, dam and L.Arklet
page.content: The Dam at the west end of Loch Arklet is a concrete structure faced with red freestone and is 32.0 metres long,10.6 metres high and 3.35 metres wide at the top. A total depth of 6.7 metres is available for supply. The water leveldropped to 3.52 metres in the summer of 1984. The waters from Loch Arklet are used to augment Loch Katrine which supplies water to Glasgow. Two men are{employed}by Strathclyde Water Authority on 24 hr.call to service and maintain the dam,tend the fish hatchery and maintain boats for public hire for fishing,for which a permit is required. The red freestone was barged from Balloch to Inversnaid and winched up by Blondin pulley which was driven by {hydro electricity.}The dam was started in 1909 and finished in 1914
